Subject: Fire Safety Audit and Contingency Planning at Airports.
Regarding.

In the wake of a significant fire eruption at an electrical substation near Heathrow Airport
on the night of Thursday, March 20, 2025, a substantial power outage occurred, forcing the
closure of the airport until midnight on Friday, March 21. Heathrow Airport, one of the world’s
busiest hubs, was compelléd to halt all flights on Friday, impacting more than 1,300 flights and
approximately 2,91,000 passengers.

2. This incident highlights that all major Indian airports are ready to handle emergencies,
especially those involving fire and power outages.

3. In this regard, | have been directed to request all the CASOs to take following measures
at their respective airports: -

(). Conduct a fire safety audit: Coordinate with the respective Airport Operators, Airport
Rescue and Fire Fighting (ARFF) services, Airport Fire Service and local fire services
to conduct a comprehensive fire safety audit at each airport.

(i). Prepare contingency plans: Ensure that updated contingency plans for handling of fire
incidents and Building evacuation Contingency Plan are in place, including clear roles
and responsibilities for CISF personnel as well as other stakeholders during such
emergencies.

(ii). | Organize mock drills: To conduct fire mock drills as well as Building evacuation drills
at all major airports to assess preparedness and improve response mechanisms in co-
ordination with airport operators. This drill should simulate fire incidents at key locations
within the airport and power outages affecting critical systems.

4. A consolidated compliance to this effect along with brief of exercise so conducted
including no of agencies and staff participated may be submitted to this HQ through respective

Zonal DisG at the earliest for perusal of competent authority.

5. This has been issued with the approval of competent authority.
